Advantage on STR checks/saving throws. Bonus Damage (see table) on STR weapon attacks. Resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing. Can't cast spells while raging. Duration: 1 minute or end of first round that you haven't taken damage or attacked a hostile creature.
Armor Class when unarmored is 10 + DEX + CON (stacks with shields).
Gives/grants advantage on attack rolls (toggle on first attack of turn).
Advantage on Dex saves against effects you can see. Inactive if blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.
You can attack 2x per Attack action.
Gain 10 ft/round speed while not wearing Heavy Armor.
Advantage on initiative. You can act on surprise rounds if you rage first thing.
Extra weapon damage on crit increases by 1 weapon dice. Increases to +2 at 13th and +3 at 17th.

Rage only ends early if you fall unconscious or choose to end it.
Use the larger of your STR score or STR check result.
STR and CON scores increase by 4 each, up to 24 max.
See PHB for details.

Subclass.Name: Path of the Berserker
Subclass.Feature: You can frenzy when you rage. If you do so you can make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each turn after the first until the rage ends. When your rage ends, you suffer one level of exhaustion.
You cannot be frightened or charmed while raging and pre-existing effects are suspended for the duration of the rage.

As an action, choose a creature you can see within 30 feet. If they can see or hear you, they must succeed on a WIS save (DC = 8 + proficiency + CHA) or be frightened of you until the ned of your next turn. You can use your action to extend this effect; it ends if the creature ends its turn out of line of sight or more than 60 feet away.
You can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against any creature that damages you while within 5 feet of you.

Regain Bardic Inspiration uses on short or long rest.
As action grant friendlies within 30 feet advantage on saves vs fear or charm until end of your next turn.
Learn 2 extra spells from any class. Choose 2 more at 14th and at 18th.
If you roll initiative with no Bardic Inspiration uses left, you regain one use.

Learn 2 spells of your choice from any class (that you can cast). These count as bard spells but do not count against the spells known cap.
Expend a bardic inspiration use when you make an ability check to add the amount rolled to the check.

During this time you can use an action to end the effect and cast suggestion on it without spending a spell slot. The creature automatically fails its saving throw against the spell.
You add WIS to the damage of any cleric cantrip.
Spend at least 1 minute (up to wisdom score) meditating. Either learn about the history of an object or the immediate surroundings (see PHB for more details).

You gain one of the following benefits: Archery: You gain a +2 bonus to attacks made with ranged weapons. Defense: Gain +1 AC while wearing armor. Dueling: Gain +2 to attacks with 1H melee weapons while no weapon is in the other hand. Great Weapon Fighting: When you roll a 1 or 2 on the damage die with a weapon you are wielding in two hands, you may reroll that die and use the new result. Protection: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield. Two-Weapon Fighting: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.
On your turn you can use a bonus action to regain 1d10 + fighter level HP. Recharges on short or long rest.
On your turn you can take an additional action.
Choose a martial archetype. Note: if you choose Eldritch Knight, please level as Eldritch knight from level 1.
You can attack 2x per attack action. This increases to 3x at 11th level and 4x at 20th level.
You can increase one ability score by 2 or two scores by 1 at 4th, 6th, 8th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level.
Reroll a failed saving throw. Use the new roll.

Subclass.Name: Champion
Subclass.Feature: Your weapon attacks score critical hits on a roll of 19 or 20.
You gain half proficiency (round up) to any strength, dexterity, or constitution check. Your running long jump distance increases by your strength modifier in feet.
Choose a second fighting style option.
Your weapon attacks score critical hits on a roll of 18-20.
You regain 5 + CON HP at the beginning of any turn that you have less than half of your HP left. This does not function at 0 HP.

Use d4 instead of regular unarmed strike damage. Damage increases with level. Bonus action unarmed strike when you use the Attack action.
You gain Ki points equal to your level. You regain these points on short/long rests. Ki save DC = 8 + proficiency + WIS.
Spend 1 ki point immediately after using Attack action to make 2 unarmed strikes as bonus action.
Spend 1 ki point to take dodge action as bonus action on your turn.
Spend 1 ki point to take disengage or dash as bonus action; jump distance doubled for the turn.
Your speed increases by 10 ft/round while not armored. This increases by 5 ft/round every 4 levels. At 9th level you gain the ability to run across vertical surfaces and liquids.
See PHB.

Use reaction to catch or deflect a missile when hit with ranged weapon attack. Damage reduced by 1d10 + DEX + level. If the damage is reduced to 0, you can catch it and throw it back. See PHB 78 for details.
Use your reaction to reduce falling damage by 5 x monk level.
You can attack 2x when you use the Attack action. Does not stack.
When you hit with a melee weapon attack you can spend 1 ki point. Target must succeed on a CON save or be stunned until the end of your next turn.
Unarmed strikes count as magical for overcoming resistances and immunities.
When you can make a DEX save and take half damage, you instead take no damage on success and half damage on failure.
You can use your action to end one effect on yourself that causes charm or fear.
You are immune to disease and poison.

Feature.Name: Tongue of the Sun and Moon

PCClass.Feature: You understand (and can be understood) in all spoken languages.
You have proficiency in all saving throws. You can use a ki point to reroll any failed saves.
You do not suffer the effects of old age and cannot be magically aged. Your lifespan does not increase however. You need no food or water.

You can use your action to spend 4 ki points to become invisible for 1 minute. During that time you have resistance to all damage except force damage. You can cast Astral Projection using 8 ki points.
When you roll initiative and have no ki points left, you regain 4 ki points.

Subclass.Name: Way of the Open Hand
Subclass.Feature: When you hit a creature with an attack granted by Flurry of Blows, you can impose one of the following conditions: --It must succeed on a DEX saving throw or be knocked prone. --It must succeed on a STR saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from you --It cannot take reactions until the end of your next turn.
As an action (once per long rest) you can regain HP up to 3x(monk level).
At the end of a long rest you gain the effect of a sanctuary spell that lasts until the start of your next long rest unless it ends early as normal. The DC for this is 8 + WIS + proficiency.

When you hit with an unarmed strike you can spend 3 ki points to start vibrations in the target that last up to (monk level) days. These vibrations are harmless unless you use an action to end them--if so the creature must succeded on a CON save or be reduced to 0 HP. If it succeeds, it takes 10d10 necrotic damage. You can end the vibrations harmlessly without using an action.

As an action you can sense the presence of any undead, celestial or fiend within 60 ft. You know the type but not the identity. You also detect the presence of any hallowed or desecrated areas within range. You can use this up to 1 + CHA times per long rest.

You have a pool healing up to 5 x paladin level. With this pool you can: Touch and heal any creature as an action. Spend 5 points to cure any disease or neutralize poison on a target. This has no effect on undead or constructs.

You gain one of the following: Defese: While wearing armor you gain +1 to AC. Dueling: While you are wielding a melee weapon in 1 hand and no other weapon you gain +2 to damage with that weapon. Great Weapon Fighting: Can reroll 1s or 2s on damage dice for two-handed weapons. Protection: When a visible creature attacks a target within 5 feet of you you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage. Must be wielding a shield.
When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack you can expend a spell slot to add 2d8 + (n-1)d8 radiant damage; n = level of slot. Max is 5d8. Damage increases by 1d8 on undead and fiends.
You are immune to disease.
See PHB 85.
You can attack 2x when you use the Attack action. Does not stack.
You and allies within 10' gain +CHA bonus to saving throws while you are conscious. Range increases to 30' at 18th level.

You deal 1d8 extra radiant damage on hit. Stacks with Divine Smite.
You can use your action to end one spell on yourself or one willing creature (touch). Uses: CHA/long rest.

3rd : protection from evil and good, sanctuary 5th : lesser restoration, zone of truth 9th : beacon of hope, dispel magic 13th : freedom of movement, guardian of faith 17th : commune, flame strike

For 1 minute add CHA to attack rolls made with your weapon; the weapon also emits light as by the light spell. The weapon is considered magical for the duration. You can end this affect at will on your turn or if you are not holding or carrying the weapon (or are unconscious).
Undead or fiendish enemies within 30 feet must save (Wis) or be turned for 1 min (or until they take damage). Turned enemies must flee.
Allies within 10 feet cannot be charmed while you are conscious. The range increases to 30 feet at 18th level.
You are always under the effect of a protection from evil and good spell.

As an action you can emanate an aura of sunlight for 1 minute. You shed light for 30/30 feet. Enemies starting turns in the bright light take 10 radiant damage. You have advantage on saving throws against spells cast by fiends and undead. 1x/long rest.

Subclass.Name: Hunter
Subclass.Feature: Choose one of the following: Colossus Slayer: Deal 1d8 extra damage to wounded foes 1x per turn. Giant Killer: When attacked (hit or miss) by a Large or larger creature within 5 feet, use your reaction to counterattack. Horde Breaker: Make an additional weapon attack against a creature within 5 feet of the original target 1x per turn.

Choose one of the following: Escape the Horde: Opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage Multiattack Defense: When hit with an attack you gain +4 to AC against all other attacks by that creature for the rest of the turn. Steel Will: You have advantage on saves vs fear.

Choose one: Volley: Use your action to make a ranged attack against any number of creatures within 10 feet of a point you can see. This consumes ammunition as normal. You make a separate attack roll against each target. Whirlwind Attack: Use your action to make a melee attack against any number of creatures within 5 feet of you. Make separate attack rolls for each target.

Choose one: Evasion: When you make a DEX save for half damage, instead take half damage on a failed save and no damage on a successful save. Stand against the Tide: When missed with a melee attack, use your reaction to force the creature to repeat the same attack against another creature (not itself) of your choice. Uncanny Dodge: When an attacker you can see hits you with an attack, you can use a reaction to take half damage instead.

You can create spell slots out of spell points (up to 5th level). Slot Level | Cost 1st | 2 2nd | 3 3rd | 5 4th | 6 5th | 7 As a bonus action on your turn you can spend a spell slot (no level restriction) and gain sorcery points equal to the spell slot level.

You gain 2 metamagic options; gain one more at each of 10th and 17th level. Only one can be used per spell unless otherwise noted. Careful Spell: Spend 1 sorcery point to allow a number of creatures up to CHA to automatically succeed on saving throw against the spell you modify. Distant Spell: When you cast a spell with range of 5 feet or greater, spend a sorcery point to double the range. Touch spells gain a range of 30 feet if this is used with them (same cost). Empowered Spell (stacks): Spend 1 point to reroll up to CHA damage dice and use the new rolls instead. Extended Spell: Spend 1 point to double the duration of a spell (of natural duration 1 minute or longer). The maximum duration is 24 hours. Heightened Spell: Spend 3 points to give one target disadvantage on the first saving throw against this spell. Quickened Spell: Spend 2 points to change a casting time of 1 action to a bonus action for this casting. Subtle Spell: Spend 1 point to cast a spell ignoring verbal or somatic components. Twinned Spell: Spend (spell slot level) points to target a second target when casting a spell that can only target one creature (and not self).
Regain 4 sorcery points when you finish a short rest.

Subclass.Name: Draconic Bloodline
Subclass.Feature: Choose a type of dragon as your ancestor. Refer to the table for damage types. You also speak, read, and write Draconic. When you make a CHA check when interacting with dragons, you have expertise if you have proficiency.
Your HP max increase by 1; this happens at each level. When not wearing armor, your AC is 13 + DEX.
When you cast a spell that deals damage of the type associated with your ancestor, you can add CHA to one damage roll. You can spend 1 sorcery point to gain resistance to that damage type for 1 hour.
As a bonus action, you gain a fly speed equal to your current speed. This is disabled while wearing standard armor.

As an action, spend 5 sorcery points to exude an aura of awe or fear out to 60 feet. For one minute (or concentration) each hostile creature in the aura must make a WIS save or be charmed (awe) or feared (fear) until the aura ends. Creatures that succeed are immune to your aura for 24 hours.

Gain THP = CHA + class level when you reduced a hostile creature to 0 HP.
Add 1d10 to a saving throw or ability check before the effects occur 1x/rest.
Gain resistance to a damage type (except magical weapons or silver weapons). You can change this damage type after a long or short rest.

When you hit a creature with an attack, you can use this feature to remove the creature until the end of your next turn. If the creature is not a fiend, it takes 10d10 psychich damage when it returns.

None
Your spells (except cantrips) are stored in a spellbook.
You can cast wizard (ritual) spells. You do not have to have them prepared, but they must be in your spellbook.
You can use an arcane focus.
Once per day when you finish a short rest you can regain up to level/2 (rounded up) spell levels of slots. None of the recovered slots can be 6th level or higher.
Choose an arcane tradition as outlined in the PHB.
Choose a 1st and a 2nd level wizard spell in your book--you can cast them at their lowest level without expending a slot.

Choose 2 3rd level spells. You always have them prepared and they don't count against the number of spells you can prepare. You can cast them each without expending a spell slot once per short or long rest.

Subclass.Name: School of Evocation
Subclass.Feature: Gold and time you spend to copy an evocation spell into your spellbook are halved.
You can exclude 1 + spell level creatures from an evocation spell that requires a save. They take no damage and automatically succeed on any saving throws due to the spell.
Cantrips that allow a saving throw now do half damage (but nothing else) on a successful save.
Add INT to the damage of any wizard evocation spell you cast.

When you cast an evocation spell of levels 1-5, you deal can deal maximum damage. This does (uses - 1)d12 necrotic damage to you. The damage done resets (to zero) on a long rest and ignores resistance and immunity.
